article.title: BAE Receives Army Contract for Bradley Fire Extinguishing System Upgrades
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: BAE Systems has received a U.S. Army contract worth $11.6 million to provide engineering changes to the Bradley Automated Fire Extinguishing Systems for up to 419 Bradley reset vehicles. The contract is managed by the Army's Tank-Automotive and Armament Command Life Cycle Management Command.
